Comment: If you read the article, it seems to be more of an ironic use of passive voice, imitating the style other outlets use to let the perpetrators have distance from the damage they've done. I mean, this paragraph could go harder, but it's pretty damning:   > I have never seen a government get so many things wrong, in so many different ways. It was like an Obamacare website every 18 hours. It was like the soft opening of Jurassic Park. And these were not the sort of run-of-the-mill snafus that are endemic to any large organization. They all had something in common: People who thought they knew better than everyone else took on work they didn’t understand, and sidelined the people who did. They were making mistakes, quite simply, because the people who didn’t make mistakes were gone, and because there was no one left to tell them not to, or to correct them when they did.  Or:   > Rather than acknowledge its propensity for pressing random buttons just to see what happens, the administration has codified many of its mishaps as policy. (A fair number, of course, were always matters of principle merely masked as incompetence.)  And:    > The driving force behind all of these errors is a carelessness about the world today that stems from a disregard for how it will look tomorrow, and a deep-seated loathing of the people who keep the lights on. On a case-by-case basis many of these were accidents. In the aggregate they constitute an ethos: a determination to break things in a way that the next person won’t be able to put back together—to shatter a way of life so thoroughly that in the future, no one will even try.
Author: SlyReference

Comment: Yes, the core of the problem is Republicans but my worry is that Democrats will continue help them even further than they already have.   Correction, if the DNC didn't screw Bernie out of his run in 2016 we would've avoided ALL of this. A lot of people didn't vote for Hillary because they felt they were not being given a real choice. And they weren't. They were cheated. My ideology is progressive but I live in a deep red area. If they let Bernie run without interference in 2016, he would've won. I had a lot of male friends in my area who were rightly pissed off about what they did to Bernie.   You need to have been paying attention to the news to understand what the deal with Gavin Newsom is. Conservatives have been trying to pass laws allowing genital inspection of little girls in sports to confirm if they are in fact a little girl. There have been documented efforts to pass such laws in West Virginia and Kansas. This is framed as an bill to "protect women" from an unfair disadvantage against trans girls in sports. I find it highly insulting to women and lacking in any data to back up the reasons for doing so. This is also a non-issue that only serves to hurt women and  little girls. There is a very negligible amount of trans girls/women in sports. It also legally places little girls into a situation of abuse by an adult. It's meant to deter women from sports altogether. Gavin Newsom saying he doesn't want men in women's sports will likely open the floodgates to such bills. He doesn't care. He's sacrificing women and children for his political career. I find it absolutely disgusting.   Yes Republicans are undoubtedly the core issue. I don't want Democrats to help them further than they already have.   How is not asking for a redo or recount of the election not a massive fuck up? They didn't even lose. The tabulation machines were rigged. Democrats just accepted it and cried home. That pisses me off to no end. It makes me feel like they sold us out. The only other option is absolute incompetence. They didn't do anything about Dejoy. Nothing about the bomb threats. Nothing about Elon literally buying the election. You don't need an extensive investigation and trial to determine, yes that was in fact a bomb threat. And NOTHING. Again, Romania redid their election just because they had similar bomb threats. This was willful neglect in protecting the election.
